Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Low Molecular Weight Dextran Sulfate in Islet Transplantation

Trial_Design.evidence: Twenty-four subjects were randomized to receive either LMW-DS or heparin during islet transplantation.

Intervention.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of low molecular weight dextran sulfate (LMW-DS) compared to heparin in preventing IBMIR.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of low molecular weight dextran sulfate (LMW-DS) compared to heparin in preventing IBMIR.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was stimulated C-peptide response measured 75±5 days post-transplant.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not implemented due to the open-label design.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Twelve participants were randomized to each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome showed no significant difference between LMW-DS and heparin (1.33±1.10 vs. 1.56±1.36 ng/mL, p=0.66).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups, primarily related to immunosuppression.
